description:
Stop by here everytime I'm in the city. I order the plate me a falafel or the flying falafel pocket and never miss their cinnamon baklava. The price is cheap for the quantity they give. If I want varities I go for the triple deluxe with shawarma, falafel and crispy chick's all in one for only $9.50 (What!?)

Their pitas are freshly made, soft and fluffy inside out. Their falafels are also fresh and are delightful balls of goodness.

They tend to get pretty packed and busy. You can always place an order via the Yelp app and just go pick it up. The only downside is that they are on the streets and you might have to park somewhere else and walk to the restaurant. There are a couple of tables outside, but I'd rather take it out and eat at home than sit on the streets of the city to enjoy the fresh food. Love this place and will definitely go back again.
author: Shivani R.

description:
Crispy chicken in a pita wrap 8.20 and seasoned fries for 3.50.

After a year of walking past this place, I have finally submitted to my cravings.

The chicken had great texture like crispy chicken should have. It was like eating crispy chicken out of a kangaroo pouch. Except you eat the kangaroo pouch too. 

It's a hole in the wall and there is no seating. Like a kangaroo pouch. Great for late night food for late night working, but note that it closes at 8:30pm so it's not really a late night snack unless you get it to go. Speaking of which, you should not get it to go because it will get cold. It tastes better warm... I think... I've never had it while it's warm, but I imagine it would have been better. 

Taste: It tastes great even when it's cold. 52/54 would recommend.

PS. I would exclude the carrots. They stuff too much of that stuff in there.
author: Daniel K.

description:
This establishment is essentially a hole in the wall with limited seating and offers 100% vegan food with several items that are also gluten free. There is a small counter with 4 stools outsides but no indoor area. Since there was a open seat I chose to eat outside, but I would not recommend this when the weather becomes colder. I stopped by for lunch and they were not busy at the time. I ordered the Spicy Falafel Pita Pocket and most of the veggie toppings. They do have several sauces that go on the sandwich but their descriptions were not listed. The sandwich was prepared very quickly and wrapped nicely. However, the sandwich tasted okay, I felt as if it was lacking some flavor and the veggies and falafel could have been mixed together to have a equal flavoring with each bite. It also could have been more spicy. I was also disappointed because my pita, falafels and the fries inside the sandwich were lukewarm. The fries were seasoned well. On the other hand, the portions were plentiful and the pita bread was soft. 

Overall, I would come back but I would request that my food be hot next time.
author: Dave S.

description:
A lil hole in the wall with pretty much only pickup. The fact that everything on the menu is vegan is quite awesome and still very tasty. Their spicy falafel is pretty awesome but I wish they would a tad more spice (give it some kick :D ).

I had the hummus bowl this time and wish they added more veggies. Its just a ton of hummus with a ton of falafel (which is great!) but please add some veggies :)
author: Taylor Z.

description: The falafel is fine. I've had a lot of falafels in my life and this one is just above VORF (value over replacement falafel). Everything on it is vegan but you feel like it'd benefit from just a little bit of a dairy sauce. I'll check out the chicken at some point. It's pretty fast and might be my pre-bart-to-oracle-arena-meal based on where I work.
author: Misha T.

description:
Delicious! Spicy falafel balls are genius. 
Putting French fries in my pita is also genius. The pita is fresh and thick and soft. There is no need to say anything else. Wish I had room in my belly for the vegan banana shake.
author: Astra G.

description:
Located in edge of Tenderloin, place is sorta sketch so if you're here visiting try to make it here before sunsets.

Good food for the price, main stuffing is falafel with additional veggies like diced tomatoes & lettuce along with their house sauce.

Opted for the combo 1 which consists of a full pita and fries.

Come here if you want a quick fix for falafel and very price friendly.
author: Steven H.

description:
Ordered the falafel sandwich a few days ago through postmates. I found a long hair cooked in my food. Then my boyfriend found a hair in his food. When I reported the issue about my order, I only received $10 back. Probably the worst first experience.
Suggestion: wear hair ties or a hair net if your hair sheds a lot? I'm not sure if people want to find a string of someone else's hair while they're chewing food or a hair sticking out of their pita pocket from a bite.
author: Krystna M.

description: Great food and big portions for the price you pay. Highly recommended, especially if you're vegan or vegetarian!
author: Justin W.

description:
This joint may be a whole in the wall, but the food is good.  We enjoyed everything we had.  They give quite a large serving of fries though, not sure if this could ever be a bad thing.  They come with some sort of spices, very good flavor.  No ketchup needed.  The dolma are very soft and super good.  

I had the falafel plate and thought it was a really nice serving size.  

My partner had the falafel pocket, fries and baklava and he liked everything.
author: Gabeal D.

description:
It's really good, ok price. That's about all
I can say at this point now just trying to finish the review.
author: Kyle C.

description: I was in San Fran for the day and wanted something vegetarian and near  UC Hastings campus. There's no seating except one table outside the take out or delivery shop. I had their pita with everything in it (which includes fries), the falafel is the best I've tasted, it was moist and tasty but my fries were cold when my order came up. I would have given them 5stars if my fries were hot. The guys were great behind the counter.
author: Ruby A.

description:
Came for a quick lunch. It looked like a super hipster place to eat, and I decided to just try it out. 

The only reason why I took off a star is because they had asked me how spicy I wanted it to be and I said very spicy. I didn't eat it there, or else I would have asked if they really did give me their spicy one, but it was definitely NOT Spicy. It was very plain, but I get that kind of often, where people assume that I don't actually want it spicy and they may dial it down some. But I LIKE my food spicy. 

Overall, the quality of food was great and it was a fairly short prep time. There's only 2 seats at a counter outside that they just prop out, so it's a grab and go place. I got the #1 Combo which was the Pocket and seasoned fries, would def recommend.
author: Jean T.

description:
I've passed by the Flying Falafel so many times, and I finally had the chance to eat here for lunch the other day.

It was my first time ordering here, so I didn't make any modifications.  I ordered the falafel pocket with everything, including all the veggies.  It was delicious, and so filling! I could only eat half, and saved the other half for dinner.  Though, I think next time I will just order it with lettuce, tomatoes, and carrots.  I don't mind pickles, but I prefer not to have them in this case.  Just my preference.  Bonus: they put some french fries on top of the pita!

I also ordered the cinnamon baklava.  If you're already treating yourself to a pita, you should keep it going with the baklava!  It's been a few days, and I still think about how yummy it was!

Prices are very reasonable, and service is fast.  It's near 6th Street, so it isn't a great area.  Seating is limited to 2 stools outside, so I got mine to go.

I want to go back and try their spice falafels.
author: Vira P.

description:
BEST Falafel I've ever had!!! TBH, I don't even have the right words to describe how mouthwatering this place is! Typing this is making me want it at this very moment. They flew their way to my heart :,,,) 

Location: It's on Market street but don't expect an actual restaurant. It's a little easy to miss, so keep your eyes open! It's designed to be one of those grab and go kind of places. They do have one table outside with four stools, so if you're lucky, you can probably eat and sit. 

Staff & Service: Friendly, funny, and fast! I can tell this place can get pretty busy, because there were a few people waiting in line and waiting outside, but this one/two man band will get your order out quick!

Food: Mouthwatering! Flying with flavor! Helllllllllla goooood! Portions are decent enough to share. Unless you want to be selfish, then go 'head. I ordered the Super Combo #1 - Pocket & a side of fries. The Pocket was packed with goodness and did not lack any "meat" (note: this is a vegetarian place), it was not massed with vegetables, or was it too saucy. The falafel balls inside the pocket was THEEE cherry on top for this meal. I think it was supposed to be spicy but I could not really tell. I did not even mind it though because I was too busy enjoying my lunch. The pita bread was soft and fresh, and it was strong enough to hold the contents. The fries ...oh laaaawdddd... were addicting!! Crisp and had the perfect amount of seasoning. Not too salty and had the right amount of spiciness to it.

A must try for me next time is the organic banana milkshake and their cheesecake!
author: Rachel C.

description:
Came here yesterday on my lunch break, around 12:45pm -- a few coworkers recommended it and it's close-by to my office, so I went for it! A block away from the Civic Center BART station and a bit hidden along Market St, The Flying Falafel is a solid choice for quick and tasty Mediterranean food.

You may *think* there's a line to order when you first show up, but it's actually probably just hungry customers waiting for their (FLYing) falafel --- the employees are quick at taking orders.

I got the spicy falafel pocket -- around 5 or 6 spicy falafel balls stuffed into half a slice of pita bread, hella veggies, some hummus, and topped with french fries. I waited for around 7 minutes while the cooks threw out a few more orders before mine. They called me to the counter, and stuffed the pita with falafel and veggies in front of me, which I appreciated. 

There's a raised table with 4 seats right outside, but I took back my pocket to the office because I didn't want to sit in the cold and the to-go bag didn't come with napkins.

I enjoyed the spicy falafel pita pocket! I ate all the fries first because they were pretty much falling out and I didn't wanna risk dropping one. The pocket is tasty, though the falafel weren't as spicy as I had hoped and the pita bread was sticking to the wrapper. It's tasty and filling for under $9, and decently healthy to boot. I'll probably explore the city more for other options, but it's great to know I have The Flying Falafel in my *back pocket* when I need it.
author: Rahul R.

description:
Sometimes you just luck out and stumble upon a gem.  This was the case with Flying Falafel.  Two friendly workers guided me through a quick order process of a full sized sesame falafel.  
The pita was soft and fresh, it didn't fall apart under the weight of the falafel and veggies and sauce.  The falafel themselves were cooked perfectly, crisp on the outside and warm and pillowy inside.  
Complimenting those little balls of goodness were a bevvy of pickled veggies and a light sauce.  Making this an instant classic especially when considering the couple minutes it took and how much it cost.
author: Josh C.

description: Such a unique place. The food is great. Somewhat of a sketchy area though. So be prepared. The service is great. They are very quick and they do listen to you. The food has great taste and the sauces that they include are not to spicy/ too "mute". I do recommend it!!!
author: Olive R.

description:
Quick, affordable lunch option in the Civic Center area! The pita pickets are a perfect to-go option that's also vegan. Filled with fresh veggies and your choice of sesame or spicy (my favorite) falafel balls, the pita pockets are satisfyingly filling and a nice change of pace from your typical sandwich. 

I typically get the snack size pita which is $5, while the full pita is $7. Their pitas are fluffy, the falafels are well seasoned, and the signature sauces are especially tasty. I also love how you can add fries to your pita pocket! The guys that work here seem to genuinely enjoy what they do and I always enjoy watching them throw falafel balls into the air as they assemble the pockets.

During prime lunch time the already tiny shop gets packed, so either go at off hours or order ahead for pick-up. I also recommend getting your order to-go since there are only a few stools available to eat outside. The Flying Falafel has a hole in the wall feel and are easy to miss on Market, but they're definitely worth a try!
author: Deanna Y.

description:
If the lines out onto the sidewalk aren't evidence enough, these charming guys bring more than just great service in one of the smallest kitchens I've ever seen. My go to is the Spicy Plate but the new vegan 'chicken' is darn good (they can run out by the end of the day). They do MealPal, Eat24, and are pretty quick unless you show up right at lunch (so try to get there at 11:55 AM or after 1:05 PM.

And don't forget to get a frequent falafeler card! you will fill it up pretty fast.
author: Mike V.

description: The best falafel joint. Great options, inexpensive, tasty and easy. Grab, eat, repeat as necessary
author: David T.

description: Amazing Vegan food. It's like total fatty food, and I ate it as such. I had fries added to it, and got fries on the side of my spicy falafel pita pocket. Everything here is Vegan, and ultimately even if you're not vegan you'll love this food.
author: Hong T.

description:
I have eaten shawarma in the Middle East. Not saying that makes me an expert but sort of setting a baseline here.

Is it authentic to add French fries? I'd say no - this is the first time I've seen this.
Now, is it delicious? Oh yes!
It was one amazing order and I savored every bit.

The only downside is ... There's no comfortable place to enjoy this. There's a stand of sorts but it seems dirty.
author: Sunder I.

description:
Falafels are a good snack to munch on.  It's so good that it can be quite addicting.  After passing by this joint, I thought to myself, falafel pocket?  Where's the meat?  However, I saw the combo which includes fries and I was instantly sold.

- Falafel w/ Fries - Uber satisfying!  The falafels are evenly distributed throughout the pita pocket giving you the perfect bite of the crispy falafel and refreshing yet sweet and creamy slaw.  Paired with seasoned fries elevating each bite to a whole nother level.  

My friend ate half of his pita pocket (no fries) and said he was full.  I finished mine.... And the fries.

*This is a vegan restaurant, duhhh Linda *facepalm*
author: Linda N.

description:
I first discovered Flying Falafel at the Berkeley location...only to come across it next to my work in San Francisco. 

Location: Between Powell and Civic Center BART on Market Street. The store is literally a whole in the wall. It is super small with like 4 stools on a table outside of it. 

The food: The spicy falafels are the ways to go. The plate and the combo with the spiced fries are incredible. Amazing portions, super filling, and great price. The service is also really fast, which is opposite of the Berkeley location which can be quite slow. 

The plate is essentially a deconstructed pita. So you have all the fillings in a box, topped with hummus and the pita cut up on the side. 

The combo is a full pita sandwich that has seasoned fries on the side. 

Overall, it is the perfect place to get some lunch during work.
author: Chris O.

description: Barely acceptable. Not sure why ratings are so high - the fries were overly salty, and the flavor inside my falafel pita was bland and uninteresting. Didn't finish my food, though I will concede that the portions are generous and this is good value for quantity.
author: Catherine H.

description: The best falafel in a pita pocket that I've ever had! I like my falafel on the saucier side and had them make it spicy. They even topped it off with a few of their signature garlic fries, which were also very scrumptious  Definitely going back there and spreading the word!
author: Sheila P.

description: Fast service, cheap, filling, and convenient to eat on the road. I'm more into the falafel pita pockets than the new crispy chicken (the texture is fun but the taste is slightly dull) but at least the crispy chicken comes with fries! Service is friendly and this is probably the closest thing to good street food in SF. Plus they accept credit cards which is nice. I have yet to try their banana milk shake but it looks delicious!
author: Lydia Z.

description:
Pitas so moist and fresh you would swear there was butter.

But no, this restaurant is very much vegan/vegan friendly. I've walked by this place many times, but never knew its popularity and renown menu. I'm happily a fan after today.

AMBIANCE is chill. It's reminiscent of a pop-up shop- no sitting here, besides a small table outside the store with four seats. I was lucky to get here just before the lunch rush and grabbed a seat (you should too). 

ORDERED super combo #1 - flying falafel pocket sandwich with spicy falafel balls, and fries ($9.90), purity orange mango paradise drink.

FOOD was delectable. The pita was the softest and freshest I've ever had. I'm not a huge fan of falafels, but this place really won me over. The purity drink was an excellent addition to the meal. 

RATING is a solid four. Looking forward to coming back and trying the cheesecake, which I hear is a hit!
author: Nicholas G.

description:
This is your hole in the wall restaurant with great food and great service. I have visited this place a few times now and the quality is consistently food. If you are on the hunt for a good falafel place, this is the place.  

PROS:
Good service, great people
Reasonable pricing (get the pita wrap deal! It comes with yummy fries)
Takes cards
Delicious food! (who knew vegan can be so tasty)

CONS: 
Limited seating. This is not a sit down restaurant. 

PRO tip: order ahead via yelp or call to place an order, long lines around lunch hour.
author: Sunny L.

description: This place has the best falafels hands down. It's a small place nestled in Civic Center with not a lot of seating. But the quality and flavor they provide is bar none. I honestly don't know anywhere else that can top their pitas.
author: Kevin O.

description: Going, going, gone....downhill. Too bad because this used to be a great spot. Seems they just don't care anymore. And it shows.
author: Markus N.

description: The falafel are delightful: petite, crunchy bites of joy! But let's talk about the plant based milkshake- rice milk, ripe banans and cinnamon...yes please!! I would have given a 5 star rating but the toppings didn't impress, mediocre at best... but thank goodness for that milkshake...gave me life!!
author: Jade L.

description: One of the best falafels in town. Had Pita pocket with spicy falafel. This is my second visit here and not the last one for sure.
author: Prateek R.

description: I can not not go here when I'm in the city! Love there fries! Not to mention the chicken pocket! Yum
author: Mary L.

description: Great selection of options, really fresh (second time here), and great customer service.
author: Alan W.

description:
So this place showed up on Meal Pal so my friends and I decided to try it for lunch. We ended up having the Falafel Frisbee, and I am happy to report that this will probably be one of my more favorite picks for food in the area.

The falafel balls were delicious, and they were nice and hot when I got them so it looks like they cook them fresh! The taste was also on point, and wasn't watered down like many other places I have been to in SF. 

The portion size was large, they gave a lot of hummus and veggies, and there was a good balance of sauces, they don't put way too much on. There are also some sauces on the side if you want even more than usual. 

The place is a bit of a hole in the wall, but it was pretty easy for us to spot since there were a lot of people waiting in line. The food also came out rather timely for the size of the line, and the workers were super nice.

Overall a great choice, and now I have a restaurant I can look forward to in the area.
author: Tyler T.

description:
Date of visit: 08/12/17

There were no vegan options at the Pistahan Festival, so I had Flying Falafel on my to do list for sometime. 

PROS:
- Nice fully loaded pita sandwich. I'm not a big pickle fan but the salty sour contrast was good. I like the full load of veggies
- they topped it with a few fries
- good pita 
- good amount of falafel, but as others have noted, spicy is not spicy. Not sure what the non spicy version tastes like.
- will need to try the deconstructed plate next time since the last bites were a bit soggy.
- found the food court at Westfield mall close enough for nice seating and still reasonably close so food stayed somewhat warm. 
- Since this was early evening 4:30pm, there were only two parties ahead of me and I got served fairly quick. Also, there were a few stools available at table outside had I wanted to stay at the location.
- guys were friendly enough and efficient in making my order. 

NEUTRAL:
- The banana shake was good, too sweet for my taste and will likely not do it again. I can see the appeal though
- I was starving, so I ordered a full order of spicy fries. Nothing special but they did go down fast.
- $20 out the door and there were no leftovers

CONS:
- sketchy area of Market Street, looking forward to trying their Berkeley location
- no longer had combo with fries, so over spent $$s on a full side of spicy fries which I did not really need - but ate the whole damn thing anyway
author: Stephen H.

description:
I am giving them 3 stars just because I do not like to hurt businesses with my reviews.
I can not understand why all the restaurants  in San Francisco are not clean from the inside or the outside, for example this place is disgusting from the inside , how can they keep a good hygiene ? And it seems the people here do not care.
author: Aziz A.

description: This place is always so crowded. Kind of a hole in a wall restaurant, mostly good for takeouts. The food is amazing, the falafel were so crunchy and all the flavors just hit the spot of what you expect a good falafel wrap should be. Would come back again!!
author: Kaylee P.

description: Best vegan felafal bowl I've had! Love this place..! They have so many options i can eat this everyday..!
author: Prachi S.

description: So good. Don't judge the food based on the interior of this joint. Some of the best falafel I've ever had
author: Priyam P.

description:
I ordered the Combo 1 and it was the best falafel  I've ever had!! Very friendly staff.

Thank you guys!! #Vegan
author: Solongo O.

description: Yummy vegan food! The texture of falafel was spot on. Generous portions and decently priced too.
author: Ramya T.

description: This might just be the best falafel I've ever had in any place, including Israel. I had the falafel, the banana drink and ordered a side of hummus which was enough hummus to feed a family of 6. Great spot, will return next time I'm in San Fran.
author: Jayme S.

description:
I was just physically assaulted by a customer in line who punched me, shoved me, grabbed me by the shirt and threw me on the concrete outside all because I had gone directly to the front counter to pick up the order I had placed and paid for. He thought I was from Grubhub or Postmates, which is still no reason to physically assault someone. The management did nothing to help and in fact did not even serve me my food because they wanted the commotion out of the store. I never once physically defended myself or did anything to threaten anyone. I was left with many scrapes and bruises and that man left untouched, able to continue eating there with management support. 

Don't order your food and try to pick it up--management will allow you to get beat up.

Edit: I think he works there. Pics are up. Mgmt please confirm.

This guy was a lot bigger than I am since I was assigned female at birth--I am a transgender male. When this man shoved me, my coffee spilled. When the cops came, he said I threw my coffee at him. Not true--had I tried, there would have been at least one drop on him which there was not. I never touched that man. He is nearly double my size-- I never try to pick a fight with anyone, and I would never pick one against someone that much bigger than me. 

Do not support Flying Falafel. They endorse violence. They do not support their paying customers. 

I just called management. The manager Rubin denied that that man works there and I was given zero apologies.
author: Yvonne C.

description: This Falafel is the bomb! All vegan with gluten free options. Full of flavor, moderately priced. Limited seating (4 stools.) Nice guy's working there. Perfect size, excellent flavor.
author: Cassandra W.

description: Overall, the falafel was pretty good. Just a little dry though, but they do offer spices to add on top. The fries have a nice seasoning on top, recommend those. I have the one new chicken option pictured, I did not try it but my friend said it was great. The location is also not the best, it doesn't seem like a safe area. There's only 2-3 seats total available so it might be a better to go option than dine in.
author: Priya B.

description:
Great and fresh but I just take the half sandwich. Falafels are good and crispy. 
It's a restaurant too small and only 4 places at the table outside.
author: Marie-Claire L.

description:
Just ok. The falafels were good, the hummus was good, the food was good. Nothing special but it was food. 

I guess I didn't read the Yelp reviews clearly enough because I was craving some protein packed salad with all the toppings. Alas, this place is vegetarian only. No meat.
author: Lori T.

description: Cute little hole in the wall. Street food at its finest, and vegan/gluten free. For being a small little spot (smaller than a food truck) the place is clean, staff was super friendly and helpful. Food was fresh, falafels actually are made to order not sitting under a heat lamp. Hummus is creamy. Vegetables fresh. And the pita is also fresh/soft/freakin delicious. They have another location in Berkeley too. Near ish shopping, so if you're at the mall, walk down and get some and skip over the crappy food court. Also it's in close proximity to the warfield. Will visit again.
author: Taylor T.

description:
The falafel here tastes like it's been hand-crafted and chiseled by a jeweler who devoted years of meticulous polishing and shaping for each and every falafel churned from this establishment. It is quite extraordinary. But what's even more extraordinary is that this restaurant actually gives a decent amount of falafel for the price. Often times I order the falafel at other restaurants, and to my dismay, I receive only a couple falafel. But here? I can stuff my cheeks like a chipmunk, juggle a dozen, and play 8 games of simultaneous hacky sack all at the same time with the amount of falafel they give.

It simply cannot be beat. No other Mediterranean restaurant can even dare oppose this restaurant in the category of falafel. They best bend the knee.
author: Ankur K.

description:
I was really hungry before work and this was the only place that was open by 10am and allowed takeout around this area! I am so happy I got it! I have only gone once, but I ordered the "Plate Me". 
First thing I noticed was that it was a huge portion for only $7.70. There were various veggies, spicy falafels, and humus. It also came with a side of pita bread.
Every time I walk by there is a line, and as far as first impressions, it was amazing and I need to go back!!!
author: Kassie E.

description: I really enjoyed lunch here! I was at a seminar down the street and was a little worried about finding somewhere I could eat, since I need to eat gluten free.  The gluten free options here are clearly labeled.  I got the Plate Me, and it was delicious! I was stuffed by the time I finished it all, great portion size for the price and every bite was wonderful.  The line wasn't too bad, nor was the wait once the order was placed.  I will definitely stop by here again the next time I'm in the area..
author: Ashleigh M.

description: I love eating here! The customer service is wonderful, with very kind people serving your food. I usually get the flying falafel plate or pocket, but recently I tried the chicken shawarma and fell in love with it. It's an ideal location as it's right next to the Berkeley bart station and Berkeley City College, and only one block from UC Berkeley campus! It's completely vegan, and they also offer a homemade banana milkshake and baklava! (Which is delicious by the way) If you like middle eastern food or are vegan, this is the spot for you!
author: Sami M.

description:
O . only had an hour be
F . fore logan were
F . ffffin hungry plus all
I . initial restos we
C . checked were
I . ither packed or closed
A . and we walked here
L . legit sf mixed crowd

B . better only order
A . "adult frisbee"
L . ladies next to me
L . like can't finish it
E . evening friday
R . ruckus fun time
author: Dan B.

description:
It's fine, decent even, but honestly I don't think I would go here if there were literally any other mediocre falafel spot around, just because their set-up is so annoying with the two lines and no place to stand and wait (much less eat) that isn't the urine-soaked Market Street sidewalk... 

The older dudes are super nice but there's one younger guy who works there who I've seen make a customer CRY. TWICE. Like almost farcical levels of rudeness haha.
author: maggie l.

description: Great food, fast and friendly customer service. Excellent quality for the price! I eat here at least once a week as my office is right nearby. Highly recommended for a quick bite!
author: A M.

description:
Awesome vegan Mediterranean spot hidden away in a pocket in SoMa. Food is all made fresh and right in front of you for a not bad fare. You'll be under 9 bucks for some damn good and very filling street side Mediterranean food. 
Regular Falafel: You'll be under 8 bucks, it's pretty tasty, and it's easy to eat with one hand. I was satisfied with this. (Half: Under 6 bucks)
Plate Me Option: Harder to hold since you get a big to go box, but very filling. You'll be under 9 bucks. 
Banana Smoothie: Relatively overpriced, but tastes good. Not a bad pick for a first-timer
Environment is pretty poppin. Lot's of people roll through for their affordable, tasty falafels on the daily. 
Been there about 10 times now.
author: Tejas K.

description: Great falafel for a reasonable price!! If you come here during weekday lunch hours, it's better to order in advance online - the line outside can scare you. But in reality, it's usually pretty fast. It's literally a hole in the wall, with a small outdoor seating area for four people max. I love the spicy falefal plate, it's easier and less messy to eat. It's a big portion, so you will have plenty of leftover. It's good for sharing too. Also, the seasoned fries are so gooooood!!! I can't stop eating them hahaha. Btw you know why it's called The Flying Falafel? Because they'll toss a falafel and catch it and tell you "That's why it's the flying falafel." Lol!!!
author: Priscilla L.

description: The falafel pocket is to die for. Everything is vegan that is definitely a plus. The falafels a smaller than other places but their falafel is cheaper.
author: Madhu J.

description:
Mmm delish! I have seen this place on my many walks on market and have always been fascinated by the line and frequent patron activity. It totally appears to be a hole in the wall that's well liked! After yelping it I only found awesome reviews! The guy is super fast and nice I could tell he works hard. I ordered the plate for my bf and I to share I could see the portions we're decent sized and we were taking food to a trivia night. 
I will definitely go back and order the half pita or full dep on my hunger. It's a decent portion and the falafels are fresh and delish. They ask you if you want it mild or spicy and the spicy has a great amount of flavor. I would definitely go back and try their banana shake when I'm down to splurge.
Overall great service, fast and delicious food, minimal but perfect options and had its own taste. I love supporting hole in the walls like this!
author: Priya S.

description: Bad food prep practices. Unfortunately I saw behind the scenes... Delivery van and hot holding food carriers disgustingly dirty. Ask to see their kitchen and check out the bathrooms before eating here. Hopefully they've taken a food safety course and have improved.
author: John Y.

description:
Placed my pick up order using Grub-hub. Right after placing the order I got a text that the food will be ready within 20-30 minute time frame. I went there within the time frame and my food was still not ready. I had to wait extra 5-7 minute. 

Food- My order was incomplete! I ordered the falafel plate, there was no pita bread in it. The banana shake had big 3-4 chunks of banana. The falafels were cold.

The whole experience was a disappointment!
author: Mansi Y.

description:
Meh. 

Spicy falafel pocket - not spicy. Not really anything, there wasn't a lot of flavor. I'm reading the reviews and maybe I got an off day? Or maybe you MUST add fries (they were out) and/or douse it in sauce. 

Hopefully you can grab a seat (there are four stools just outside) or plan on taking it somewhere to sit and eat. I tried walking and eating but, despite it being in a little bag, it's not very easy to do. Unless you don't mind getting paper in your mouth and food all over your face.
author: Crystal M.

description:
I literally walked by The Flying Falafel so many times without knowing or realizing that it is a vegetarian, vegan, gluten free heaven. I finally had a chance to try it today and just wow, it is worth every penny. I read a lot of reviews regarding the lines and opted to order online for pickup. Lo and behold, my order was not ready when I got there, but I typically expect this for pick ups and it didn't really bother me that much. 

I was really curious about their menu item, the cripsy chick'n pocket, but opted to go with the flying falafel pocket sandwich since it was my first time. You can get a half pocket ($5.50 without tax) or a full pocket ($7.70 without tax). I went with the full pocket and it was insanely filling to the point where I will most likely skip dinner. It had a healthy serving of falafels, cucumbers, cilantro, pickles, tomato, lettuce, and 3 different sauces including a spicy one. It is topped off with a few fries. Fry obsessed me was thrilled by that. Tfalafels themselves were incredibly flavorful and easily carried the whole dish. The sauces were good, but I wish there had been a little bit more of the spicy one. The fries were just so so for me, but eh the place is called Flying Falafel, not Flying Fries so I was just happy to have delicious falafels.

Typically, the flying falafel pocket sandwich comes wrapped in some paper. I requested a box and was informed that they don't usually give a box with the pocket sandwich, but that I could have one just this once. I really appreciated that they were able to accommodate my request because I deinfitely would have made a mess trying to eat it on public transit without a box. I'll keep this in mind and just get the plated version next time.

Overall, this place is a solid food option. The location is small and unassuming and only has a tiny 4 seater table outside but the food is hearty, filling, and delicious, especially for the price.
author: Lakshmi M.

description: My husband and I each got the full falafel pita pocket and it was quite tasty and filling!  (If you're not super hungry, I'd suggest getting a half pocket!). We also got a side of fries, which was also delicious.  The service is friendly, but be prepared to wait a bit for your food if there's a line.
author: Barnali D.

description: I usually don't eat vegan food, so when I tried the flying falafel pocket, I had a really bad stomach ache right after eating it. I only had a couple of bites and did not even finish the whole thing. I don't recommend eating here because this place might be contaminated.
author: Brenda T.

description: We ordered the frisbee platter and it was awful. It wasn't accurate to what the menu said, and instead we got a big bowl of hummus. Really disappointed in their offerings.
author: Nupur S.

description: Went here with 3 other folks from the apa convention. 3 of us got the pita pocket with spicy falafels and another got the hummus/pita plate.. all were tasty, affordable! Unbelievable food! So yummy and big portions! I had to keep the other half of it for late lunch. Come here! Just stay vigilant, not a place you want to be alone..
author: Jessie C.

description: Either do it right or don't don't do it at all, the falafel flavor was bad but when presented in suggy plate, then don't
author: Shahi I.

description:
My husband and friend were in town to watch a musical and we only had a half hour before the show started. We needed something quick, tasty and fresh. My friend recommended Flying Falafel and I took her up on that recommendation.

Her idea ended up being the second best part of the day (aside from the musical we watched). You basically order at the counter, wait, and eat. Limited seating, super casual and a takeway experience more so than anything. My husband and I ended up eating on the go but it was SO wonderful, we didn't mind it. I ordered the combo #1 which was the falafel and the fries. 

Deliciousness and flavor in EACH DARN BITE! AMAZING.

My husband and I were quiet the whole time we were eating our falafel pita. Filled with fresh veggies, bomb sauce and the falafel. Vegan. Fries were a plus. 

I heard amazing things about their organic banana smoothie. Must try it next time. Looked good in the pictures.

Thanks Flying Falafel for a wonderful experience (we came back the same day and ordered the exact same thing). Food is life!
author: Darina H.

description: Mmmm Tasty !!!! The falafel  melts in your mouth like butter and the pita and veggies taste so fresh and yummy!  It's a little hole in the wall with no real seats but who cares. It was truly satisfying AND delicious
author: Dee G.

description: I love flying falafel...in Berkeley. The guys at this location handle money then touch food without wearing gloves. Additionally I was here Saturday and ordered the spiced kabob hummus frisbee but instead was presented with a pit pocket! After I said that's not what I ordered they gave me what I thought was correct yet it turned out to be hummus with falafel...again, not what I ordered. If you want dirty fingers on your pita and employees that can't handle legitimate concerns from a customer then this is the place for you. I'll be eating at the one in Berkeley where they won't rip you off and charge you for something then give you a cheaper meal.
author: Mycky E.

description: This place gets busy, so come early! Their pitas are so fluffy and their sauces, yum! They have this orange 'mango' sauce sitting on the left with the other sauces they throw on your order. Grab it, cover your food in it, and enjoy! I can spend $8 here and leave so extremely happy. You can ask them to throw a bit of hummus on your pocket. I'd definitely recommend this place. Hole in the wall... pretty much one of the best in SF!
author: Marlene T.

description:
I am now a firm beliver of Vegan eating. Forget about everything you've heard about vegan eating and all the negative comments, and try out Flying Falafel and your tastebuds will do all the talking after. 

We ordered the Flying Falafel Pocket, one with the spicy falafel and the other with the seaseme falafel with all the veggies, fries, and the banana milkshake. I personally do not like the taste of cinnamon but I didn't even know the milkshake was made from cinnamon or else I wouldve requested it without it, but  I'm glad I didn't know because it just tastes so good all together. They do make it with pecans also, so if you have nut allergies its not for you. 

I don't know what it is but green sauces are always the best in my opinion. So, I personally loved mine with extra green sauce. YUMMMMMMM! 

Carbs are great, and the pita bread here is so good and fresh and just so amazing. 

The staff is super friendly. It's a small little place with a small table outside and a four barstools.
author: Yinja L.

description:
If all vegan food was like this, I would definitely be vegan by now. Wow! I mean it's easy for falafels to be vegan, but still, to taste this good? This will be my go-to food if I want to be healthy haha. 

I ordered the Flying Falafel Full Pita Pocket ($7) and it was delicious! In the beginning it actually doesn't taste that good, because all you see is an ocean of carrots and cabbage. It's like eating a salad with nothing on it. After you get 1/3 of the way through it gets better. There's around 7-8 falafels per pita pocket. I actually like my falafels to be slightly spicy, so this was a perfect mix. Also the sauce is like yesss! It's a little bit tangy and sweet, and there's evident vegetables in there. 

Definitely will be my go to place if I become vegan haha. Also the price is nice :).
author: Vivienne C.

description: I recommend it. My wrap was delicious. My only complaint is that I wish they had better seating. Maybe some foldable chairs and tables that they can fold up and take inside when they close would be nice.
author: Nadine C.

description:
Visiting SF for our anniversary!

Pros: amazing food, vegan friendly, awesome and fast service! 

Cons: this is in a rough part of town so I wouldn't suggest going at dark, it is not a place you sit down at. 

Deliciousness! They need more of these!
author: Ceci F.

description: Horrible, rude customer service. Couldn't even get my food before they were mean. Just asked a simple "are you guys open" too
author: Edgar S.

description:
Squeezed in a standing-room only place in the spotty mid-Market area, Flying Falafel contains so much yumminess in such a small space.

I got the pocket, which was wonderfully-overstuffed with falafel, cucumber, pickle pieces, carrot, potato/fries, tahini, parsely, etc, in a warm, thick pita pocket. 

The food is excellent, the workers are nice, the area is sketchy, nowhere to sit, I'm already set to go back.
author: Veg V.

description: Yummy!!! A must try. We were told while trying to figure out what to order that "everything's hella good".  He was right. We had pockets (1 spicy, 1 regular) and a side of fries.  So so good!!
author: Sarah P.

description: Best vegan falafel ever! I really liked my sandwich and I would definitely recommend this place to everyone.
author: Niharika S.

description:
I absolutely love this place! It's a tiny hole in the wall that packs a great punch - it's by far one of my favorite joints to grab a sandwich. Highly recommend the spicy falafels in a pocket sandwich - it's filling and really yummy.

Only wish would be a nicer place to sit since it just has a table outside to stand around with a few seats as well.
author: Anubhav J.

description:
This place has a ton of potential.  Fantastic falafel.  

Here's the bad news:
Served on whole wheat pita which is heated with steam.  This causes the sandwich to be gummy, and soggy.  

During peak times, there is a wait as the fryers are very small and take awhile to reheat after a batch is cooked.  The staff has a microphone to call you when your order is up, but on busy Market Street, it's very hard to hear if it's working at all.  And why customers are crowded around the door, trying to hear if their order is ready.

Flying falafel, I look forward to you opening in a location with a grill and deep fryers to fit your business.
author: EC N.

description: I absolutely love this joint. I only ate there once but it was scrumptious vegan goodness. The staff working the counter was hella cool. And when I got my food the portions seem huge. I always worry about still being hungry after going vegan but this was clearly not the case after my meal. The only bad side is the area-it's in a really sketchy part of upper market. As long as you can break the atmosphere this place is definitely worth the stop.
author: Robert C.

description:
I was starving after fasting for 18 hours (don't ask me why) and was super excited to give The Flying Falafel a try! 

Pro tip 1: snag a seat at the front before others take them! However, be aware that if you come alone, you might be called back up to the front to pick your sides dishes and lose your spot. 

Menu is simple enough, everything includes falafels. 

I ordered:
1 Plate Me // $8.16 after tax 
+1 Generous amounts of hummus! I really liked it because it wasn't doused in olive oil, but it didn't taste super fresh either. 
+1 LOTSA vegetables! Seriously, just get everything. This comes with carrots, diced pickles, tomatoes, some type of white radish, and lots of cabbage. 
+1 Falafels were not bad! I've had better, but at least these were not bursting with oil and had the perfect crunch. 
+1 Hot pita bread was YUM! If you didn't want to get a pocket pita, get this plate and you would get a long more bang out of your buck. 

Pros:
+Simple menu. I like that it's easy to read, easy to choose and easy to order. Oh yes, and cheap! 
+Generous serving! You'll see what I mean, but you literally can't find anything "small" here...we are all growing adults here! 
+Nice service. Guys were super nice, but....

Cons:
-Hella slow service. I was literally the 4th person in line but waited 30 minutes just to get my food. What would happen during lunch rush? 
-As well, not a really organized system. He didn't ask for my name and referred me as "miss" to come get my food. What would happen during lunch rush?? 

Tips/Observations: 
-If you buy 10 falafel pockets, you get the 11th free! Plus, if you love them so much, you can also buy their special edition t-shirts for $20 more. 
-Again, outdoor seating which is only....5 chairs total? Definitely more of a grab and go place. 

Overall, not a bad spot! I did enjoy my meal but felt like it was getting kind of boring (and cold) as the meal progressed.
author: Hurjane V.

description:
We ordered takeout from this restaurant for lunch via ubereats. Food was delivered within 45 mins so that was great! 

We got the plate me, banana milkshake and seasoned fries.

Plate me: we debated getting the pita pocket vs this but ended up with the plate as we thought the pita may be soggy by the time it gets delivered. Luckily our order came with a side of pita :) the plate is nothing amazingly flavorful. It's standard salad, falafel, tomatoes, pickles, cucumber, hummus, side of hot sauce. Large quantity especially for lunch. I personally thought it has way too much hummus on the plate and it made everything too bland. Overall filling plate for lunch for $7-8. 

Banana milkshake: yum!!!! Love the mixture with cinnamon and vanilla. Not too happy with the $7 though

Seasoned fries: loved these as well. $4

Liked it but did not love it. Its a decent place for lunch but food is pretty standard.
author: Minati D.

description:
The taste is just awesome & don't wanna be racist or sexist and kinda " ist" but the short guy he makes the best one ever !!! 

Drove San Jose to SF just to eat falafel like atleast once every two month or so!!
author: Jay D.

description:
Flying falafel popped my falafel cherry last year. I wanted to compare it with other fallafels before I formed an opinion. I've tried a few other places and each time I'm disappointed it's not flying falafel... 

I always order the full with spicy balls and all the vegetables and sauce. They're so good!!!  I can't quite put into words how much I love this place. Every time I'm in San Francisco I have to stop here!
author: Nicole H.

description: I appreciate this joint for offering a quick and healthy option. The pocket sandwich comes loaded with veggies and is very filling. And to top it off it is decently priced! You'll see why this place is called The Flying Falafel when they wrap up making the sandwich. I certainly enjoyed the spectacle! This is another place I pass by often when I'm downtown. They have limited seating but Westfield is close by with plenty of sit-down spots. If you're a local (or even if you aren't depending on how often you visit SF), grab a frequent buyer card to collect stamps and get a free pita pocket after purchasing ten.
author: Lauren H.

description: Absolutely terrible. I'm not sure why this place has 4.5 stars. In pictures, the food looks GREAT... in actuality, it was probably the worst falafel sandwich I've ever had. The fries were terrible and stale, the pita was hard, the veggies looked like they were sitting around all day, the tahini had no flavor, the falafel itself was soggy and not flavorful, and the service was very poor. This place is really tiny and more of a pay and go spot which was fine but it looked very unhygienic and the guy working in the back was putting his hands on everything. One whole pita and a half was almost $18 which was ridiculous to me. I would recommend to avoid this place at all costs.
author: Sonia P.

description:
A fantastic vegan spot in downtown SF, a few blocks walk from Westfield Mall. It is a tiny spot with a few chairs outside so you will need to find somewhere else to eat (Westfield Mall). 

Very fresh ingredients & tons of veggies. Got 2 plates with veggies and falafel and you can any toppings and sauce. The falafel is flavorful and crispy, fresh out of the fryer. 

Excellent place for a filling healthy lunch/dinner!
author: Sharon L.

description:
The falafel and hummus are some of the best I've had. I got a falafel plate and it came with so much food! I was impressed with the amount of food given for such a low cost.

FALAFELS: crispy, flavorful, not dry at all, plentiful 
HUMMUS: smooth, creamy, flavorful
VEGGIES: was a little too much for me, strong pickle flavor 
RESTAURANT: I saw the guy make it, and he moved so fast so I was surprised at the amount of time it took for the food to be made
author: Emily X.

description:
I thought it was ok. I think the salad inside the full pocket was somewhat bitter and took away from the other flavors of the remaining ingredients. 

The service, however, was fantastic.
author: Jeanee V.

description:
3.5 stars

Decent food at inexpensive prices! Quick and efficient service! However I advise to take the food to go as there is limited seating.
author: Alyssa C.

description:
This place is easy to miss as you're walking down Market, but it's well worth seeking out. The space is super small and only offers some outdoor seating (which isn't much of a perk given the location), so it's best to take the food to go. 

Their falafel is seriously A+. It's always hot and crispy, never greasy. They offer a pita pocket in two sizes (small or large), and it's stuffed with fantastic veggies, sauces and fries on top! You can also get a plate, which is more or less a deconstructed pita pocket. They offer a few sides, such a dolmas, hummus, and baklava, but really the falafel is the star of the show. 

A pro tip for people who are taking the pocket to go: ask for less sauce because it can make the bottom of the pita pretty soggy and things can start to fall apart from there. 

The staff there are always super friendly, and sometimes they'll even entertain you by flipping falafel into the air and catching them in the pita. This is a quick, healthy and cheap place for lunch or dinner.
author: Regina L.

description:
Was I super impressed by the looks of where I was about to get food from? ... Not particularly. Was I interested in trying out a local eatery? ... Absolutely!

The Flying Falafel got really good reviews on Yelp, so we figured we would get one of the falafel pockets while we were on the go in San Francisco. It was busy when we got there, so it took some time for us to get our order even though it seemed like they were continuously making the falafel balls. There was only one person working, and we didn't mind the wait, especially since we were satisfied when we tried out our food!

We had ordered the falafel pocket with everything on it which included tomatoes, cucumbers, carrots, pickles, lettuce, tzatziki, and some french fries on top. I asked if they could make it only a little bit spicy so a small dash of sriracha was included as well.

Overall, we thought that the pocket was full and flavorful. The falafel balls themselves were crispy on the outside but soft and tasty on the inside. The veggies inside added extra crunch and an additional layer of flavor. My only comment is that everything ended up being weighed down and partially soggy because of the runny yogurt sauce. If I had to order again, I'd probably ask for the pocket to be made spicy since the bites that had spice were more flavorful than the ones without spice.

Overall, I think this place was worth a try. There's really not much seating around but I would plan on eating the falafel pocket as soon as it comes out!
author: Rashmi G.

description: I've walked past this place for years and the timing was never right for me to stop by and have a falafel.  Yesterday my time finally came and I got to enjoy this delicious meal.  I got the #1 combo with the pocket and fries and I ate my combo with delectable enjoyment.  Definitely recommend if you love Falafel.  I've had so many disappointing falafel pockets that have turned out flaky and you need a beverage to prevent you from choking from the dryness.  This was definitely not that!
author: Andrea C.

description: Awesome staff! Great food! Went here for the first time after global run day and was amazed by how friendly the the staff was and the amazing food. Definitely recommend this place!
author: Joey N.

description: This is the best tasting falafel in the city at a very reasonable price. The salad options are generous and tasty.
author: John O.

description: Best falafel place in the city. Humus, pita, falafel all were too good. This place is always crowded and you have to order TOGO as they don't have dine in option.
author: Saurabh M.

description:
Been meaning to try this place out. The shop is small, the guys at the front are friendly, food comes out quick. 

I got a spicy pocket and the side salad. The spicy pocket was good, good portion sizing and the veggies in the pocket worked well with all the sauces. I'd say my one thing with it is that with them stored in the plastic bins, there's lots of water runoff. This can make the pocket semi soggy. Best to eat it as soon as possible in this case. The side salad was just a box with all the veggies that normally go into a pocket covered in sauce. I'd probably have been better off getting either more falafel or fries or something just to switch up the flavor. 

All in all, it was good but I'd have to switch how I eat it and what I order. Can't take it back to the office since it just isn't as good as when it first came out due to the issues I mentioned. If the veggies could be drained, a lot of it would be solved. I probably wouldn't order another salad again though since the next time I'm here I would totally get another pocket.
author: David C.

description: Went to San Francisco for a week long holiday and being vegan, found it pretty difficult to find good places to eat. However this place was an absolute hidden gem!! It's so small you can almost walk straight past it but definitely don't make that mistake! I had the mock chicken pitta and my mum had the classic falafel one, and I had a cheesecake for dessert that was hands down the best vegan cheesecake i've ever had - I went back for another slice the next day but they'd all sold out  Highly recommend this place though 5 stars!!
author: Emilie M.

description: Best falafel in the city hands down I absolutely love how traditional the food is it tastes great reminds me of my moms!
author: Anthony J.

description:
We walked 20 mins to stand in a line for another 20 mins to order, and then wait about 15 mins for our food to be ready. So, Flying Falafel requires commitment. Pro tip: order online ahead of time, and you skip the ordering line & only have to wait in that "pick up your food" line. Huge difference. 

A good falafel, plated or in a pita, is a thing of beauty. One of the best I've had was in Le Marais neighborhood of Paris, where there's one legit falafel hut that people travel from around the world to patronize. Flying Falafel had a similar hole-in-the-wall vibe, but the goods weren't made with as much thoughtfulness as the Parisian version. Watching them "assemble" (or, more literally, throw together) our dishes was chaotic. Vegetables flying, condiments being squirted across the counter, falafel balls being plopped agressively into pitas. It was all a bit stressful, actually. I thought: how could something so haphazardly put together be worthy of such hype? Would it even taste good? And that extra sauce I asked for, did anyone pay attention to that?

In the end, our falafel plates were tasty, but I felt the sauce to veggie ratio was way off. There was a big pile of cabbage and carrots that just didn't get eaten because there wasn't enough condiments to go 'round. The falafel balls were nice and crispy though, so that counts for something. And the pita - noticeably soft and warm. 

Compared to Liba Falafel in Oakland, with their impressive salad & sauce bar, Flying Falafel was just okay. Probably more authentic, but just came across as basic to my tastebuds.
author: Nique F.

description:
I didn't see any flying falafel balls here.  I guess it was because they were busy and didn't have any time to play with their food.  

The place is small.  Inside, there's only a place for you to order and pick up your food.  No seating inside, hell, there's no standing room either.  Outside, there's a small table with 4 stools to sit and eat your food....if it's raining, you're screwed. (Although, I hear it doesn't rain often in California, yikes)

Most people took their food to eat on the go.  I, on the other hand, am messy, and will drop food all over the place if I attempt to multitask by walking and eating.

This was my first meal in SF.  Starving, it was a good choice.  They made it fresh on the spot, frying the falafel and stuffing it into the pita.  I asked for everything except for hot sauce.  They also stuffed a few fries into the sandwich.
author: Ming T.

description: Great falafel, super fair prices, and speedy service!
author: Dani P.

description: The falafels were good, but they sold out of pita bread by dinner time! Such a shame... The hummus and falafels were good and I'm glad I tried it, but I usually prefer having meat.
author: Edward W.

description:
This is one of the best falafels I ever had !
It is a very small place which only accepts togo orders, and there can be a very slight wait in  receiving your order. I highly recommend their pocket falafel -- which is basically falafel, inside a pita wrap with veggies and hummus, tahini sauce, etc. The falafels here are absolutely delicious and  must try ! The food is very yumm and super satisfying !

Looking forward to having my next pocket falafel from here when I visit SF.
author: Kamiya M.

description: To be honest, this was my first time having a falafel but WOW, it was packed with a lot of flavor! I got the sandwich falafel (in a pita) with all the fillings and a little bit of spicy sauce and French fries! I also got the banana shake which was delicious. I never thought eating vegan food would taste so good. The only thing I would suggest would be having another location, I felt that this location was difficult to get to (almost impossible if you have a car since it's right on Market St.) The table was full when I was there, it would have been nice to be able to sit down and enjoy this messy sandwich. But overall, great place to grab something quick and yummy
author: Devin C.

description:
I had food delivered, never been to the restaurant.
The food was delicious, the portions ample.
I don't recall the menu item name, but it was a big plate of hummus, falafel, dolmas, shredded veggies, cukes, pickles, and some pita

I'm sold.  Excellent job.
author: Steve B.

description: One of the best falafel places in Sf. Despite the low key outfront, the falafel pocket is amazing! The freshly baked pita, freshly fried falafel balls and the seasame sauce. All items are vegan but this is not those hippie vegan place, completely normal, happen to be vegan, even meat lovers will stop by. I tried everything on their menu. Vegan cheese cake, banana milkshake, bakalava.. Healthy food, happy people, good soul. Love the little gem in the big street! Sometimes I would make my way there to just get a falafel fix.
author: Shell J.

description: The falafels are hot and dense and fresh. But that takes time. Waited over 15 minutes for my falafel pita. And not a big line. "Everything" on the pita does not include some of the pickled deliciousness I love most with my falafel. And strangely, the pitas were so fresh and hot, they didn't keep their structure, so when trying to eat them, they dissolved in my hands. It was still tasty, but messy, not piquant and not quick. I'd go back, but with those expectations.
author: David A R.

description:
Fantastic falafel place that would otherwise go unnoticed if it weren't for the long lines around lunch time and in the later afternoon!

I had a chance to grab something after work a few times and each experience was a great one! The food is great and the guys behind the counter are friendly and will occasionally throw falafels in the air as a spectacle for you. 

Here's my opinion of everything so far:

-Sesame Falafel Pita Pocket: We asked for a bit of spicy sauce, so he obliged. Very filling with quality, flavorful ingredients. The star of the show here are the falafels, but everything else accentuates the flavors well. I prefer the veggies because it cuts the saltiness and makes it taste fresher. The spicy sauce has a zing with the spice so I prefer the sesame sauce for its mildness. Fries add a nice touch, kind of reminds me of McDonald's fries.

-Falafel & Hummus Plate: HUGE dollop of hummus topped with falafels, veggie piles, and sauce. They serve you a side of pita, but I recommend ordering a whole pita too (especially if you love bread). The pita itself is pillowy soft and delicious with their hummus and you're definitely gonna need more pita to handle all of the hummus they give you.

-Cinnamon Baklava: Very flaky and buttery, but would have preferred it at room temperature than refrigerated. 

Overall, a delicious experience! Definitely worth getting and going back for!
author: Sofia R.

description: Omg this place was worth the drive over bridge. Just the best Falafel I've ever had from the bread to the Falafel to the sauce the vegetables everything was perfect fresh delicious
author: Rachel D.

description:
When billionaire's row dissolves into skid row, you can find yourself in a virtual food desert in San Francisco. Which is how it happened on the way to a weeknight concert with my friend coworker. We walked from the bar to the venue, from hipster SOMA to one of the sketchiest sections of market looking for a bite to eat. 

In the wreckage of boarded up buildings and makeshift villages, we found Flying Falafel. My friend thought it was dodgy and worried about stopping but I assured her that it had good Yelp reviews. 

Unlike a lot of places that make falafel, they only make only falafel! No gyros or meat at all. It could be for this reason that they have the best fresh made, moist, falafel. We got the snackers, which are advertised as half the size of a regular wrap sandwich. For $5, this is a whopping good deal.

Stuffed with falafel and layered with sauce and topped with veggies and French fries and another falafel, they were delicious and totally satisfying. Exactly what we needed. Even though they were just about to close for the night, the two guys graciously attended to a handful of other people that came in after us. More people rescued in the food desert!
author: Angelique L.

description: Fresh and delicious falafel downtown in an otherwise barren foodcape. The small snacker sized pita with spicy falafel was large enough for me.
author: Adrianna T.

description:
The location is really bad. The service is mediocrity as they keep yelling your name. There are a bunch of homeless people sitting next to the shop trying to buy some weed in the store next to it. 

Since this place in so tiny, there are three people crammed into a hole in the wall, and one dirty table on the street. You are constantly worried while eating there. I recommend picking your order Togo.
author: Goli M.

description:
I've been wanting to try this place for years. So glad I got to try it! I'm a huge fan of falafel pitas. This place is truly a gem. The best falafels I have ever had. Fillings were fresh and exactly what I like. I appreciate the small menu because sometimes it's hard to decide what to get. This place is very straight forward.

I also got the banana milkshake. It was a bit hard to drink in my opinion, really smooth in the beginning then clumps and unable to go up my straw later. Really good still. I wish they still had the pita sandwich and milkshake combo meal. Such a good deal!

A few things I didn't like: (1) There was only one person working there, so I had to wait about twenty minutes for my food. (2) Just about no seating space. There was just a small table for four with only three chairs. Super tiny location. (3) I was not a fan of the fries in a falafel sandwich. Not a good combo for me; would get without next time. The fries were just thrown into my sandwich and by the time I took it out to eat all the fries fell out. Not to mention, I watched a man wheel a cart of frozen fries that I believe were used by the restaurant.

Otherwise 5 stars, would come again!
author: Valerie X.

description:
A great little hole in the wall! My best friend and I almost missed this place because it is such a tiny place, but there is a little seating area for 4 right in front. By the time we got there at around 2 PM there was a small little line so we took our chance and ordered a plate to share since we had already eaten lunch. 

The falafels are smaller than any falafel I've ever had before but they were very warm, crunchy and yummy. We both agreed that the hummus was creamy and tasted fresh. However, I think it could have used some more salt if you enjoy eating hummus on its own. But when combined with the pita bread, the falafel, sauce and veggies, the hummus is absolutely delightful.
author: Jenny W.

description:
(I'm finally reviewing since I've had more exposure to falafels) 
After trying falafel at different places, I think Assaf's (the awesome owner) is the best! They're good sizes, usually fried just right and delicious sesame, spicy, or both! Flying Falafel is my favorite fast food vegan spot! It's great value, quite a lot of food even if you get a half pita. Plus, there's baklava! The banana smoothie is fair trade as well.  I have tried other menu items but a falafel pocket with hummus & veggies is the best deal, the most savory and filling to me. :) There are a few drinks and cheesecake not made in house. Definitely a place to keep loyalty to (get stamps!) Graciously tip! 
They cater !
author: Jia Hui L.

description: I know I'm suppose to love it but it was just A-OK. The flavors are good with their spicy sauce but nothing special, had better. The day I went, there was not much of a line. About 4 people in front of me. It went by quickly. Also I was hopefully for them to make my spicy pocket prettier but it was messy. Had to invent my own instagram worthy photo. haha! Would I come back? Yes but not something I would go out of the way for, plus also it's $7 for a big sandwich. I also order fries, big portion.
author: Sandy B.

description: This place is dirty. I witnessed multiple health code infractions. Not covering mouth while sneezing or coughing, not washing hands after touching cash, not cleaning serving area, and using hands without gloves to prepare food. This place is a cesspool. Never eating here again.
author: Ro B.

description: We got the falafel bowl with hummus. So SO flavorful! And filling! No place to sit and eat, more like grab and go. But that bowl was so good, I can't wait to go back. Fresh crisp falafel, pickled veggies and pita. They also have wrap options.
author: Sarmishtha S.

description:
I tried The Flying Falafel recently for dinner, and it was incredible. I ordered a pocket sandwich with spicy Falafel balls and all of the fillings. They add fries right into the sandwich, and it tastes amazing! My favorite part of the meal was the varying textures of the Falafel balls, fries, and various veggies. It is one huge, messy, delicious sandwich! 

It's more of a grab and go sort of place- there are two seats on the sidewalk, but it isn't a nice area to sit in really! Also, my sandwich got a bit soggy as I walked to my apartment, so I would recommend eating it as soon as possible.
author: Ayushi A.

description: The falafel at this joint is off the wall! Tasty! No seating but it's just a little hole in the wall in a seedy part of market street. So if you can navigate through the bullshit here it's worth the effort!
author: lenny r.

description: Hella amazing falafel and hummus. Only one guy behind the counter and he was killing it! Only downfall is that my Plate Me was a little messy, but hell, it was delicious. My friends Hummus plate was amazing as well.
author: Evelyn L.

description:
I'm loving vegan food!!! 

Superb falafel with the bread...

Oh the pita bread.. so soft and tasty I can eat just them!!

Cheese cake was the best.. I have ever eaten..
author: Kartik S.

description:
Very, very good.  I love Mediterranean food, especial falafel, and so when I saw this place close to a conference that I was attending, I skipped out on all the other attendees who were off looking for fancy-schmancy restaurants and came here instead.

I got the the full falafel sandwich.  The pita was soft but not as thick as I prefer.  The spicy falafel balls were excellent, but I found the seasoning of the vegetables to be a little blander than what I expected.  The sandwich is topped with a small amount of fries, which I've experienced at other similar establishments but still find to be a little curious.

Service was hip, friendly, and efficient.  It was definitely worth the trip during my visit to the city.
author: Lee L.

description: This place is just a little hole in the wall, nothing fancy. They have decently priced falafel pitas and quick service. It's wasn't the best falafel I've ever had but it was good enough if you want something cheap, quick and still yummy.
author: Jenine G.

description:
Alas, my falafel did not fly, but it sure smooshed with aplomb. And that spicy sauce!

A blink-and-you'll-miss-it HITW slings some seriously savory vegan fare. The pocket full o' fried love came with unlimited toppings (get the works, chump) and a healthy helping of crispy falafel balls. I mega-mealed to include two dolmades, a baklava AND a banana shake (hey, it was a long flight in to SF) and all that jazz still rung in under fifteen bucks.

By the way, that shake disappeared in two champion pulls from the straw. Delicious, and so creamy, you won't believe it's veeeeeeeeegan.

If the walk up and enter your own order system confuses or confuddles, keep in mind: they deliver. So you're welcome to stay in your office. Just open a window and who knows what Falafel may come a-Flyin'!
author: Damien S.

description: The absolute best falafel sandwich on the planet. Located on Market beteeen 7th and 6th streets. You will have to wait a few minutes for them to make it or there may be a line, but well worrh it. The "snacker" is a pretty big portion and filling.... it's only about 6 or 7 bucks. The snacker is filled with everything delicious from the falafel and veggies to their famous & unique fries. Delish!
author: Ann Rose D.

description:
The best $5 falafel pita pocket!!!

It's gluten free, vegan, and extremely tasty.

Best bang for the buck. What are you waiting for? Go go go!

I hope you give this delicious inexpensive falafel place a try. Cheers!
author: Owie N.

description:
Structurally advantaged falafel experience+ newly gentrified prime location on Market +  Affordable

FRESH - I've backpacked the ME & lived in "Tehrangeles" in LA... I learned that  that short time span from oven/fryer to mouth usually makes for a good falafel experience. Given its high turnover from an awesome location, and the food stand layout, this place has minimal time from being heated to being eaten aka structurally advantaged

CRUNCHY - TFF differentiates from other joints with very satisfyingly small sized falafel pieces yielding a *high fried surface area to internals ratio" aka think fried wings versus fried breast at KFC

MIX - There is not too much disparity between chickpea/bean mix at different restaurants, but this place managed to get the spices just right

If you're familiar with LA, this is like the SF Vegan equivalent of Bella Pita.
author: Roger L.

description:
One of my go-to lunch spots when I worked in the Tenderloin! I'm excited to try their new location in Downtown Berkeley since it's just a few minutes from my house! Hopefully the food is just as tasty. 

Although the line at the SF location is always super long during lunch time, there is often no wait in the early afternoon. Plus, even when there is a long line, the men working are always very friendly and helpful. I usually order the snacker pocket with spicy sauce because it is very inexpensive for the amount of food you receive. The falafel always tastes crispy and fresh, and they make sure to load up the pocket with tons of toppings, including veggies, hummus, and a few seasoned french fries. Although it is a bit of a commitment to visit for lunch, I definitely recommend stopping by in the afternoon for a late lunch or early dinner.
author: Lizzie A.

description:
Yay! Still in business. Only in San Francisco conversation:
Arab Guy to proprietor: "Do you speak Arabic?"
Proprietor: "No, I'm Sikh."

Still delicious, nutritious, and fun to eat!
author: Joseph T.

description: Definitely a must for French fry fanatics and falafel addicts.  Delicious, filling and VEGAN!  A favorite among my meat eating friends as well
author: Jeremy James N.

description:
Great food!  My son and I went to check this place out!  
Pros: The employees were friendly and helpful.
Cons: Extremely limited parking, no sitting area to eat in.
Overall: I highly recommend this hole in the wall that serves great food, fast service, and gracious portions. Vegan friendly.
author: Ítala P.

description: I ordered the half pita. It's pretty good. I ve saved the baklava for later. Food takes a while to be ready since it's a pretty popular place.
author: Gomz G.

description:
Pocket falafel with everything in it. Sooo good. 4.6. Hubby said best falafel he's ever had.

Cheesecake-soo good. 4.3

Baklava 4.3 sooo good

Banana smoothie. 4. Good
author: Jenny V.

description: My girlfriend and me ate here on a typical Sunday afternoon, and it was packed. The place has no seats so it's either take out or eat it like street food. Two hard working guys bust out heavy containers of salad and falafel. If there's a downside it's the steady stream of SF street weirdos who pass by to interact but they tend to keep moving.  Order one plate and split it.
author: Al C.

description: A great place for a cheap, tasty, and fast bite! Both the regular and spicy falafels were great as far as texture and flavor, and the thin fries are a great texture addition to the overall sandwich. I was also impressed by the tossing/catching falafel act.
author: Neal B.

description:
Seriously obsessed with this falafel shop (it doesn't hurt that the owner is also from Puerto Rico and blasts some of my favorite reggaeton music, but I digress). There's always a line at this place, so I've wised up and now order online. $7 for a pita pocket is pretty reasonable(not to mention, filling). There are two types of falafel you can choose from: regular or spicy. I typically go for the spice, because who doesn't like a little kick with their lunchtime chow.

Did I mention that they have a "rewards" program? Grab a card and collect stamps to get a free pita pocket (they usually give you a couple extra stamps just to get you started, too).

There is very limited seating outside this storefront, so definitely a grab-and-go type of place. Falafel is cooked very fresh (made-to-order). You can go wrong with falafel but these guys do everything right!
author: Tracy T.

description: Went because of the rating and reviews, but was not that impressed, maybe I ordered the wrong falafel. I got the crispy chicken pocket, it was meh, costumer service was fine, I'd try again and see if there is another I may like.
author: Chris C.

description: The Flying Falafel is a great place to go for a takeaway lunch or dinner. Very friendly staff and yummy (huge) all vegan menu. Would highly recommend!
author: Nicole M.

description:
Best falafel meal I've had so far in the Bay Area.

You'll smell it every time you walk past it on Market St. It really is a hole in a wall since all customers can really do is walk up to the register area and U-turn to leave. It's that small of a place.

My boyfriend and I came on a Sunday evening. Yelp said it was closed but it really wasn't. As we walked in to check the menu, the sole falafel guy tending to the place tossed us falafel balls to munch on. He tossed another customer a pita bread fragment as he was working on a pita pocket. The menu is short and sweet. You can't go wrong with the falafel pita pocket for $7. Spicy or sesame, both are great. If the guy is busy, you can order and pay on the tablet yourself.

Falafel Pocket -- The falafel balls, sauces, and veggies are packed into the pita pocket in repeating layers so you get a bit of every ingredient spread throughout your pocket (unlike a burrito, where you often have areas where there's just hella beans or rice or a massive glob of sour cream). This place seriously packs their falafel pockets. Take a fork and napkins with you as you stand or walk around outside to eat; it can be messy.
author: Liana F.

description:
I just realized why that guy throws the last falafel ball up in the air and catches it in your pita. The Flying Falafel. I'm quick on the draw.

Well, this place doesn't need a gimmick, anyway. They have the tastiest vegetarian treats you can get on this stretch of Market. I went for a Snacker, which is a half portion of a falafel that costs just under a full order. It's silly, I know, but I'm watching my figure.*

The nice dudes behind the counter will offer you several types of sauces (hot, tangy, tahini), and layer in your falafel, hummus, and all the veggies with care.
